p: Previous studies reported that monoglycerides and diglycerides had protective effects against several chronic diseases (Feltes et al., 2013). Due to the anti-diabetic and antiatherogenic effects of monoolein (Cho et al., 2010), the high level of monoglyceride in CO oil and oleoresin makes these fat samples as potential functional foods. Diglyceride is a prospective therapeutic agent for antiobesity. The effect is probably due to the increased Î²-oxidation of the fatty acids found during the metabolism of the diglyceride (Lo et al., 2008).
